message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
public class ToDoList {
    private List<ToDoItem> items = new ArrayList<>();
    private Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);

    private void setItems() throws FileNotFoundException {
        File file = new File("ToDoItems.txt");
        Scanner readFile = new Scanner(file);
        while (readFile.hasNext()) {
            String listString = readFile.nextLine();
            StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(listString, ",");
            while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
                int id = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken().trim());
                String description = st.nextToken().trim();
                items.add(new ToDoItem(id, description));
            }
        }
    }

    public void addItem() throws FileNotFoundException {
        PrintWriter fout = new PrintWriter(new File("ToDoItems.txt"));
        String inputline;
        do {
            System.out.println("add to the list? [y/n]");
            inputline = keyboard.nextLine();
            if ("y".equals(inputline)) {
                System.out.println("Enter id:");
                int id = keyboard.nextInt();
                System.out.println("Enter description:");
                String description = keyboard.next();
                items.add(new ToDoItem(id, description));
                fout.println(id + ", " + description);
            } else {
                System.out.println("Here is the list so far:");
                items.forEach(System.out::println);
            }
        } while ("y".equals(inputline));
        fout.close();
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "ToDoList{" + "items=" + items + '}';
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer.nextToken() method is used to break a string into tokens. In the setItems() method, we read the file line by line and for each line, we create a StringTokenizer to break the line into id and description. We then create a ToDoItem object with these values and add it to the items list. In the addItem() method, we ask the user to enter an id and description, create a ToDoItem object with these values, add it to the items list, and write it to the file.

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
